medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, shortness of breath, and acute kidney injury.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in his usual state of health until 4 days before admission, when fever developed (up to 39.9Â°C) with shaking chills and poor appetite. Three days prior to admission, he stopped using long-acting insulin for diabetes due to blood glucose levels less than 100 mg/dL. A dry cough developed one day before admission, followed by shortness of breath on the morning of admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, coronary artery disease, obesity, and obstructive sleep apnea. Drug-eluting stent placed in the left anterior descending coronary artery 7 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Coronary artery disease in father and emphysema in mother.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as a limousine driver, did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit substances. Lived with girlfriend in a suburb of Boston.
